item.title: What hot weather means for food safety
item.description: A billion times per year New Yorkers eat out more than a billion times a year. To help keep diners safe, the Health Department educates restaurant operators about food safety practices and inspects all 27,000 city restaurants at least once a year. Over 90 percent of NYC restaurants have “A” grades in the window, showing excellent compliance with food safety requirements. However, warmer weather creates special challenges keeping food safe. We dug into the data to find out how hot weather affects food safety.

item.title: Food and Drink
item.description: We all make choices around food and drink, but sometimes, those choices are made for us by our food environments. Our food environments include neighborhood-level alcohol access, unhealthy food access, and restaurant food safety. Additionally, drinking water quality data includes data on contaminants that are most frequently found at levels that may be of public health significant in the country’s drinking water.
